name: midnight-aurora
title: Midnight Aurora
description: A dark, elegant theme with aurora-inspired accent colors. Features deep navy backgrounds with vibrant teal, purple, and pink accents. Perfect for dashboards, developer tools, and modern SaaS applications.
author: Token Atelier

ai_instructions.critical_warning: STOP. Do NOT summarize this style guide. Do NOT extract only color tokens. Do NOT manually apply styles to existing components. You MUST complete the FULL installation process below. Partial installation will result in broken components, missing styles, and TypeScript errors.
ai_instructions.what_this_is: Midnight Aurora is a COMPLETE COMPONENT LIBRARY (not just colors). It includes 20+ pre-styled React components built on Radix UI. Installation requires copying ALL components, utilities, CSS, and dependencies.

pre_flight_checklist.description: You MUST verify ALL of the following BEFORE starting installation:
required_checks: Confirm this is a React project with Tailwind CSS configured
Identify the project's src directory structure (src/ or app/)
Detect Tailwind version: check package.json for 'tailwindcss' version (3.x or 4.x)
Locate the existing tailwind.config.js/ts file (v3 only)
Identify where global CSS is imported (app/layout.tsx, main.tsx, _app.tsx, etc.)
Check if src/lib/utils.ts already exists (if yes, MERGE the cn() function, do not overwrite)
abort_conditions: If Tailwind CSS is not installed, STOP and help user install Tailwind first
If no React framework detected, STOP and confirm with user

version_detection.description: Detect the target project's Tailwind version to choose correct files
instructions: If version starts with '4.' or '^4' -> use Tailwind v4 installation path
If version starts with '3.' or '^3' -> use Tailwind v3 installation path
If unclear, check for '@tailwindcss/postcss' in devDependencies (indicates v4)
If still unclear, check postcss.config for 'tailwindcss' (v3) vs '@tailwindcss/postcss' (v4)
When in doubt, ASK the user which Tailwind version they are using

installation_v3.description: Installation steps for Tailwind CSS v3.x projects. Execute ALL steps in EXACT order.

steps.why: Contains cn() utility function required by ALL components. Without this, every component will have TypeScript/import errors.
steps.verification: File exists at src/lib/utils.ts with cn() function exported

steps.action: COPY globals.v3.css to src/styles/globals.css (or merge with existing)
steps.why: Contains ALL CSS custom properties (--background, --primary, --secondary, etc.). Without these, components render with no colors.
steps.merge_note: If global CSS exists, APPEND the :root and .dark CSS variable blocks. Do NOT replace existing styles.
steps.verification: CSS file contains :root block with --background, --primary, --secondary, --accent variables

steps.why: Extends Tailwind with color mappings (bg-primary, text-foreground, etc.) and custom animations. Without this, Tailwind classes in components will not work.
merge_instructions: Add darkMode: ['class'] to config root if not present
Merge theme.extend.keyframes and theme.extend.animation for accordion
steps.verification: tailwind.config contains colors.primary, colors.secondary, colors.accent mappings

steps.action: COPY ALL component files from components/ to src/components/ui/
steps.why: These are the styled React components. ALL files must be copied - they depend on each other and on the index.ts exports.
steps.verification: All 22 files exist in src/components/ui/ including index.ts

steps.command: npm install @radix-ui/react-slot @radix-ui/react-dialog @radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu @radix-ui/react-select @radix-ui/react-checkbox @radix-ui/react-radio-group @radix-ui/react-switch @radix-ui/react-tabs @radix-ui/react-accordion @radix-ui/react-avatar @radix-ui/react-tooltip @radix-ui/react-progress @radix-ui/react-label @radix-ui/react-separator class-variance-authority clsx tailwind-merge lucide-react
steps.why: Components use Radix UI primitives for accessibility and CVA for variants. Without these packages, imports will fail.
steps.verification: All 18 packages appear in package.json dependencies

steps.action: VERIFY globals.css is imported in app entry point
steps.why: CSS variables must be loaded for any styles to apply.
steps.verification: Entry point file contains import statement for globals.css

installation_v4.description: Installation steps for Tailwind CSS v4.x projects. Execute ALL steps in EXACT order.

steps.why: Contains cn() utility function required by ALL components. Without this, every component will have TypeScript/import errors.
steps.verification: File exists at src/lib/utils.ts with cn() function exported

steps.action: COPY globals.v4.css to src/styles/globals.css (or merge with existing)
steps.why: Contains CSS custom properties AND @theme inline block for Tailwind v4. Without these, components have no colors.
steps.merge_note: If global CSS exists, APPEND the :root, .dark, and @theme inline blocks. Do NOT replace existing styles.
steps.verification: CSS file contains :root block, .dark block, AND @theme inline block

steps.why: Tailwind v4 requires @tailwindcss/postcss package, NOT tailwindcss as PostCSS plugin.

steps.action: COPY ALL component files from components/ to src/components/ui/
steps.why: These are the styled React components. ALL files must be copied - they depend on each other.
steps.verification: All 22 files exist in src/components/ui/ including index.ts

steps.command: npm install @radix-ui/react-slot @radix-ui/react-dialog @radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu @radix-ui/react-select @radix-ui/react-checkbox @radix-ui/react-radio-group @radix-ui/react-switch @radix-ui/react-tabs @radix-ui/react-accordion @radix-ui/react-avatar @radix-ui/react-tooltip @radix-ui/react-progress @radix-ui/react-label @radix-ui/react-separator class-variance-authority clsx tailwind-merge lucide-react @tailwindcss/postcss
steps.why: Components use Radix UI primitives. @tailwindcss/postcss is required for Tailwind v4.
steps.verification: All 19 packages appear in package.json dependencies

steps.action: VERIFY globals.css is imported in app entry point
steps.why: CSS variables and @theme block must be loaded for styles to apply.
steps.verification: Entry point file contains import statement for globals.css

installation_v4.note: Tailwind v4 does NOT require a tailwind.config.js file. All theme configuration is in the CSS file via @theme inline.

common_mistakes.description: AI assistants frequently make these errors. You MUST avoid ALL of them:

mistakes.mistake: Only extracting color tokens from the 'tokens' section and applying them manually
mistakes.why_wrong: The tokens section is METADATA for documentation only. The actual implementation is in globals.v3.css/globals.v4.css and tailwind.config.patch.js. Extracting tokens without copying files results in ZERO styling.
mistakes.correct_action: Copy the actual CSS files (globals.v3.css or globals.v4.css) which contain the CSS variable definitions

mistakes.mistake: Summarizing the style guide instead of installing it
mistakes.why_wrong: User requested installation, not a description. Summarizing without action does not modify their project.
mistakes.correct_action: Execute ALL installation steps and copy actual files to the project

mistakes.mistake: Copying only some components instead of all 22 files
mistakes.why_wrong: Components have internal dependencies. The showcase.tsx imports all others. index.ts exports all. Partial installation breaks imports.
mistakes.correct_action: Copy ALL 22 files from the components/ directory

mistakes.mistake: Replacing tailwind.config.js instead of merging (v3 only)
mistakes.why_wrong: User may have custom Tailwind configuration. Replacing it destroys their existing setup.
mistakes.correct_action: MERGE the theme.extend sections into the existing config, preserving user customizations

mistakes.mistake: Skipping npm install because 'the components are just files'
mistakes.why_wrong: Components import from @radix-ui/* packages and use CVA. Without installation, the project will not compile.
mistakes.correct_action: Run the full npm install command with all required packages

mistakes.mistake: Not importing globals.css in the app entry point
mistakes.why_wrong: CSS custom properties are defined in globals.css. Without importing it, all color variables are undefined and components have no styling.
mistakes.correct_action: Add import statement to the app entry point (layout.tsx, main.tsx, _app.tsx, etc.)

post_installation_verification.description: After completing ALL steps, verify the installation succeeded:

checks.expected: File exists with cn() function exported
Contains colors.primary, colors.secondary, colors.accent in theme.extend

post_installation_verification.success_message: Installation complete! Suggest user add a route for <Showcase /> component to preview all styled components.
post_installation_verification.failure_action: If ANY check fails, identify which step was missed and complete it before declaring success.

migration.prompt_user: After installation completes, ASK the user: 'Would you like me to migrate your existing components to use the Midnight Aurora style tokens and components? This will convert inline styles to Tailwind classes and replace custom UI implementations with the pre-styled components. Your component logic will not be changed.'

scope.description: Migrate files in these directories, but NOT the installed UI library

color_mappings.description: Map inline style colors to Tailwind token classes

component_mappings.description: Replace custom implementations with UI library components

mappings.pattern: Custom button elements with onClick handlers and styled backgrounds
Custom card/container divs with shadows and rounded corners

steps: 2. ASK user if they want to migrate existing components
3. If user declines, skip migration entirely
4. If user accepts, scan files in scope.include (excluding scope.exclude)
5. For each file with inline styles or custom UI patterns:
a. Identify inline style objects (e.g., const styles = {...})
b. Convert backgroundColor/color values using color_mappings to Tailwind classes
c. Replace custom UI implementations with component_mappings where applicable
d. Add necessary imports for UI components
e. Remove unused inline style objects
6. Verify each migrated component renders correctly
7. Report summary of what was migrated
safeguards: DO NOT change component logic or functionality - only styling
DO NOT migrate if user declines
PRESERVE all props, state, event handlers, and business logic
KEEP original file structure and component hierarchy
ASK user before making changes if uncertain about a conversion

ai_instructions.showcase_usage: The Showcase component renders all UI components for preview. User should create a route (e.g., app/showcase/page.tsx) that imports and renders <Showcase /> from @/components/ui/showcase. This provides live preview with automatic CSS sync when editing styles.
ai_instructions.auth_note: This is a premium style. User needs a Token Atelier API key. Check for .tokenatelier.json config in project root or home directory, or ask user for their API key.

v3.notes: Requires tailwindcss as PostCSS plugin. Uses JavaScript config file.

v4.notes: Requires @tailwindcss/postcss package. No JS config needed - uses @theme inline in CSS.
